page.title: 01RYEDALE (WEST)
page.content: Ryedale (West) This D-block lies two miles south of the North Yorkshire Moors National Park. The only centres of population are the rural villages of Nawton/ Beadlam and Wombleton. The former lay on the A170, the main east-west route between Thirsk and Scarborough. Nawton/ Beadlam lies three miles east from Helmsley and three miles west from Kirkbymoorside. These villages lie towards the western end of Ryedale and on the northern edge of the Vale of Pickering. This is a rural area with enclosed arable fields and pasture land surrounding farms and villages. In appearance, the countryside has cahanged little over the past two hundred years.
